de.mrapp.android.util

Class BitmapUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.util.BitmapUtil

  • public final class BitmapUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    An utility class, which provides static methods, which allow to create and edit bitmaps.
    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • clipCircle

        public static Bitmap clipCircle(@NonNull
                                Bitmap bitmap)
        Clips the corners of a bitmap in order to transform it into a round shape. Bitmaps, whose width and height are not equal, will be clipped to a square beforehand.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - The bitmap, which should be clipped, as an instance of the class Bitmap. The bitmap may not be null
        Returns:
        The clipped bitmap as an instance of the class Bitmap

      • clipCircle

        public static Bitmap clipCircle(@NonNull
                                Bitmap bitmap,
                                int size)
        Clips the corners of a bitmap in order to transform it into a round shape. Additionally, the bitmap is resized to a specific size. Bitmaps, whose width and height are not equal, will be clipped to a square beforehand.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - The bitmap, which should be clipped, as an instance of the class Bitmap. The bitmap may not be null
        size - The size, the bitmap should be resized to, as an Integer value in pixels. The size must be at least 1
        Returns:
        The clipped bitmap as an instance of the class Bitmap

      • clipCircle

        public static Bitmap clipCircle(@NonNull
                                Bitmap bitmap,
                                int borderWidth,
                                int borderColor)
        Clips the corners of a bitmap in order to transform it into a round shape. Additionally, a border will be added. Bitmaps, whose width and height are not equal, will be clipped to a square beforehand.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - The bitmap, which should be clipped, as an instance of the class Bitmap. The bitmap may not be null
        borderWidth - The width of the border as an Integer value in pixels. The width must be at least 0
        borderColor - The color of the border as an Integer value
        Returns:
        The clipped bitmap as an instance of the class Bitmap

      • clipCircle

        public static Bitmap clipCircle(@NonNull
                                Bitmap bitmap,
                                int size,
                                int borderWidth,
                                int borderColor)
        Clips the corners of a bitmap in order to transform it into a round shape. Additionally, the bitmap is resized to a specific size and a border will be added. Bitmaps, whose width and height are not equal, will be clipped to a square beforehand.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - The bitmap, which should be clipped, as an instance of the class Bitmap. The bitmap may not be null
        size - The size, the bitmap should be resized to, as an Integer value in pixels. The size must be at least 1
        borderWidth - The width of the border as an Integer value in pixels. The width must be at least 0
        borderColor - The color of the border as an Integer value
        Returns:
        The clipped bitmap as an instance of the class Bitmap

      • clipSquare

        public static Bitmap clipSquare(@NonNull
                                Bitmap bitmap)
        Clips the long edge of a bitmap, if its width and height are not equal, in order to form it into a square.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - The bitmap, which should be clipped, as an instance of the class Bitmap. The bitmap may not be null
        Returns:
        The clipped bitmap as an instance of the class Bitmap

      • clipSquare

        public static Bitmap clipSquare(@NonNull
                                Bitmap bitmap,
                                int size)
        Clips the long edge of a bitmap, if its width and height are not equal, in order to form it into a square. Additionally, the bitmap is resized to a specific size.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - The bitmap, which should be clipped, as an instance of the class Bitmap. The bitmap may not be null
        size - The size, the bitmap should be resized to, as an Integer value in pixels. The size must be at least 1
        Returns:
        The clipped bitmap as an instance of the class Bitmap

      • clipSquare

        public static Bitmap clipSquare(@NonNull
                                Bitmap bitmap,
                                int borderWidth,
                                int borderColor)
        Clips the long edge of a bitmap, if its width and height are not equal, in order to transform it into a square. Additionally, a border will be added.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - The bitmap, which should be clipped, as an instance of the class Bitmap. The bitmap may not be null
        borderWidth - The width of the border as an Integer value in pixels. The width must be at least 0
        borderColor - The color of the border as an Integer value
        Returns:
        The clipped bitmap as an instance of the class Bitmap

      • clipSquare

        public static Bitmap clipSquare(@NonNull
                                Bitmap bitmap,
                                int size,
                                int borderWidth,
                                int borderColor)
        Clips the long edge of a bitmap, if its width and height are not equal, in order to transform it into a square. Additionally, the bitmap is resized to a specific size and a border will be added.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - The bitmap, which should be clipped, as an instance of the class Bitmap. The bitmap may not be null
        size - The size, the bitmap should be resized to, as an Integer value in pixels. The size must be at least 1
        borderWidth - The width of the border as an Integer value in pixels. The width must be at least 0
        borderColor - The color of the border as an Integer value
        Returns:
        The clipped bitmap as an instance of the class Bitmap

      • resize

        public static Bitmap resize(@NonNull
                            Bitmap bitmap,
                            int width,
                            int height)
        Resizes a bitmap to a specific width and height. If the ratio between width and height differs from the bitmap's original ratio, the bitmap is stretched.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - The bitmap, which should be resized, as an instance of the class Bitmap. The bitmap may not be null
        width - The width, the bitmap should be resized to, as an Integer value in pixels. The width must be at least 1
        height - The height, the bitmap should be resized to, as an Integer value in pixels. The height must be at least 1
        Returns:
        The resized bitmap as an instance of the class Bitmap

      • splitHorizontally

        public static android.support.v4.util.Pair<Bitmap,Bitmap> splitHorizontally(@NonNull
                                                                            Bitmap bitmap)
        Splits a specific bitmap horizontally at half.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - The bitmap, which should be split, as an instance of the class Bitmap. The bitmap may not be null
        Returns:
        A pair, which contains the two bitmaps, which the original bitmap has been split into, as an instance of the class Pair

      • splitHorizontally

        public static android.support.v4.util.Pair<Bitmap,Bitmap> splitHorizontally(@NonNull
                                                                            Bitmap bitmap,
                                                                            int splitPoint)
        Splits a specific bitmap horizontally at a specific split point.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - The bitmap, which should be split, as an instance of the class Bitmap. The bitmap may not be null
        splitPoint - The row, the bitmap should be split at, counted from the top edge in pixels as an Integer value
        Returns:
        A pair, which contains the two bitmaps, the original bitmap has been split into, as an instance of the class Pair

      • splitVertically

        public static android.support.v4.util.Pair<Bitmap,Bitmap> splitVertically(@NonNull
                                                                          Bitmap bitmap)
        Splits a specific bitmap vertically at half.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - The bitmap, which should be split, as an instance of the class Bitmap. The bitmap may not be null
        Returns:
        A pair, which contains the two bitmaps, the original bitmap has been split into, as an instance of the class Pair

      • splitVertically

        public static android.support.v4.util.Pair<Bitmap,Bitmap> splitVertically(@NonNull
                                                                          Bitmap bitmap,
                                                                          int splitPoint)
        Splits a specific bitmap vertically at a specific split point.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - The bitmap, which should be split, as an instance of the class Bitmap. The bitmap may not be null
        splitPoint - The column, the bitmap should be split at, counted from the left edge in pixels as an Integer value
        Returns:
        A pair, which contains the two bitmaps, the original bitmap has been split into, as an instance of the class Pair

      • tile

        public static Bitmap tile(Bitmap bitmap,
                          int width,
                          int height)
        Creates and returns a bitmap with a specific width and height by tiling another bitmap.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - The bitmap, which should be tiled, as an instance of the class Bitmap. The bitmap may not be null
        width - The width of the bitmap as an Integer value in pixels. The width must be at least 1
        height - The height of the bitmap as an Integer value in pixels. The height must be at least 1
        Returns:
        The bitmap, which has been created as an instance of the class Bitmap

      • tint

        public static Bitmap tint(@NonNull
                          Bitmap bitmap,
                          int color)
        Creates and returns a bitmap by overlaying it with a specific color.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - The bitmap, which should be tinted, as an instance of the class Bitmap. The bitmap may not be null
        color - The color, which should be used for tinting, as an Integer value
        Returns:
        The bitmap, which has been created, as an instance of the class Bitmap

      • drawableToBitmap

        public static Bitmap drawableToBitmap(@NonNull
                                      Drawable drawable)
        Creates and returns a bitmap from a specific drawable.
        Parameters:
        drawable - The drawable, which should be converted, as an instance of the class Drawable. The drawable may not be null
        Returns:
        The bitmap, which has been created, as an instance of the class Bitmap

      • textToBitmap

        public static Bitmap textToBitmap(@NonNull
                                  Context context,
                                  int width,
                                  int height,
                                  int backgroundColor,
                                  @NonNull
                                  java.lang.CharSequence text,
                                  float textSize,
                                  int textColor)
        Creates and returns a bitmap from a specific text. The text is centered.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        width - The width of the bitmap, which should be created, in pixels as an Integer value
        height - The height of the bitmap, which should be created, in pixels as an Integer value
        backgroundColor - The background color of the bitmap, which should be created, as an Integer value
        text - The text, the bitmap should be created from, as an instance of the type CharSequence. The text may neither be null, nor empty
        textSize - The text size, which should be used, in sp as an Integer value
        textColor - The text color, which should be used, as an Integer value The color of the text
        Returns:
        The bitmap, which has been created, as an instance of the class Bitmap

      • textToBitmap

        public static Bitmap textToBitmap(@NonNull
                                  Context context,
                                  int width,
                                  int height,
                                  int backgroundColor,
                                  @NonNull
                                  java.lang.CharSequence text,
                                  float textSize,
                                  int textColor,
                                  @Nullable
                                  Typeface typeface)
        Creates and returns a bitmap from a specific text. The text is centered.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        width - The width of the bitmap, which should be created, in pixels as an Integer value
        height - The height of the bitmap, which should be created, in pixels as an Integer value
        backgroundColor - The background color of the bitmap, which should be created, as an Integer value
        text - The text, the bitmap should be created from, as an instance of the type CharSequence. The text may neither be null, nor empty
        textSize - The text size, which should be used, in sp as an Integer value
        textColor - The text color, which should be used, as an Integer value The color of the text
        typeface - The typeface, which should be used, as a value of the enum Typeface or null, if the default typeface should be used
        Returns:
        The bitmap, which has been created, as an instance of the class Bitmap

      • colorToBitmap

        public static Bitmap colorToBitmap(int width,
                                   int height,
                                   int color)
        Creates and returns a bitmap from a specific color.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the bitmap, which should be created, in pixels as an Integer value. The width must be at least 1
        height - The height of the bitmap, which should be created, in pixels as an Integer value. The height must be at least 1
        color - The color, which should be used, as an Integer value
        Returns:
        The bitmap, which has been created, as an instance of the class Bitmap

      • getImageDimensions

        public static android.support.v4.util.Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> getImageDimensions(@NonNull
                                                                                                   java.io.File file)
                                                                                            throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the width and height of a specific image file.
        Parameters:
        file - The image file, whose width and height should be returned, as an instance of the class File. The file may not be null. The file must exist and must not be a directory
        Returns:
        A pair, which contains the width and height of the given image file, as an instance of the class Pair
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - The exception, which is thrown, if an error occurs while decoding the image file

      • getImageDimensions

        public static android.support.v4.util.Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> getImageDimensions(@NonNull
                                                                                                   Context context,
                                                                                                   @DrawableRes
                                                                                                   int resourceId)
                                                                                            throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the width and height of a specific image resource.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        resourceId - The resource id of the image resource, whose width and height should be returned, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid drawable resource
        Returns:
        A pair, which contains the width and height of the given image resource, as an instance of the class Pair
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - The exception, which is thrown, if an error occurs while decoding the image resource

      • loadThumbnail

        public static Bitmap loadThumbnail(@NonNull
                                   java.io.File file,
                                   int maxWidth,
                                   int maxHeight)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a downsampled thumbnail of a specific image file while maintaining its aspect ratio.
        Parameters:
        file - The image file, which should be loaded, as an instance of the class File. The file may not be null. The file must exist and must not be a directory
        maxWidth - The maximum width of the thumbnail in pixels as an Integer value. The maximum width must be at least 1
        maxHeight - The maximum height of the thumbnail in pixels as an Integer value. The maximum height must be at least 1
        Returns:
        The thumbnail, which has been loaded, as an instance of the class Bitmap
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - The exception, which is thrown, if an error occurs while decoding the image file

      • loadThumbnail

        public static Bitmap loadThumbnail(@NonNull
                                   Context context,
                                   @DrawableRes
                                   int resourceId,
                                   int maxWidth,
                                   int maxHeight)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a downsampled thumbnail of a specific image resource while maintaining its aspect ratio.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        resourceId - The resource id of the image resource, which should be loaded, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid drawable resource
        maxWidth - The maximum width of the thumbnail in pixels as an Integer value. The maximum width must be at least 1
        maxHeight - The maximum height of the thumbnail in pixels as an Integer value. The maximum height must be at least 1
        Returns:
        The thumbnail, which has been loaded, as an instance of the class Bitmap
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - The exception, which is thrown, if an error occurs while decoding the image resource

      • compressToFile

        public static void compressToFile(@NonNull
                                  Bitmap bitmap,
                                  @NonNull
                                  java.io.File file,
                                  @NonNull
                                  CompressFormat format,
                                  int quality)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Compresses a specific bitmap and stores it within a file.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - The bitmap, which should be compressed, as an instance of the class Bitmap. The bitmap may not be null
        file - The file, the bitmap should be compressed to, as an instance of the class File. The file may not be null
        format - The format, which should be used to compress the bitmap, as a value of the enum CompressFormat. The format must either be JPEG, PNG or WEBP
        quality - The quality, which should be used to compress the bitmap, as an Integer value. The quality must be at least 0 (lowest quality) and at maximum 100 (highest quality)
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - The exception, which is thrown, if the given file could not be opened for writing
        java.io.IOException - The exception, which is thrown, if an error occurs while compressing the bitmap

      • compressToByteArray

        public static byte[] compressToByteArray(@NonNull
                                         Bitmap bitmap,
                                         @NonNull
                                         CompressFormat format,
                                         int quality)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Compresses a specific bitmap and returns it as a byte array.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - The bitmap, which should be compressed, as an instance of the class Bitmap. The bitmap may not be null
        format - The format, which should be used to compress the bitmap, as a value of the enum CompressFormat. The format must either be JPEG, PNG or WEBP
        quality - The quality, which should be used to compress the bitmap, as an Integer value. The quality must be at least 0 (lowest quality) and at maximum 100 (highest quality)
        Returns:
        The byte array, the given bitmap has been compressed to, as a Byte array
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - The exception, which is thrown, if an error occurs while compressing the bitmap
